the proposal. Mr Sergio Marchionne praised the Mirafiori workers for voting in favour of the labour reforms. He said they were standing up against "decline" and "extremism". This was notable in a country like Italy that has always been tied to the past and resistant to change, he said. Italian leaders and unionists had said that the result of the Mirafiori vote had implications far beyond the limits of Turin.
